summary_points: 1. As of April 30, 2025, total assets were $9,672,222,000, compared to $8,427,764,000 as of July 31, 2024.
2.  Operating income for the nine months ended April 30, 2025, was $1,284,123,000, while it was $1,212,479,000 for the same period in 2024.
3. Capital expenditures and acquisitions for the nine months ended April 30, 2025, totaled $482,562,000.
1. On June 2nd, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. shareholders rejected the 2024 executive compensation plan.
2.  The company amended its certificate of incorporation on June 2nd, 2025, allowing shareholders with 20% voting power (held for one year) to call special meetings.
3.  Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. increased the number of shares available under its employee stock purchase plan by 25 million on June 2nd, 2025.
1. On June 3, 2025, Ventas, Inc. issued $500,000,000 in 5.100% Senior Notes due 2032, guaranteed by the company, with proceeds intended for general corporate purposes.
2.  The offering price of the notes was 98.766% of the principal amount, plus accrued interest from June 3, 2025.
3. The underwriting agreement, base indenture, and tenth supplemental indenture are filed as exhibits.

1. As of April 30, 2025, Keysight had $260 million remaining under its $1.5 billion stock repurchase program, having repurchased 1,490,118 shares for $225 million and accruing $1 million in excise tax related to repurchases during the six months ended April 30, 2025.

2.  A lawsuit was filed against Keysight by Centripetal Networks in January 2022, alleging patent infringement;  the International Trade Commission terminated its investigation into this matter in December 2023, but Centripetal has appealed.
3. Keysight filed a lawsuit on January 23, 2025, seeking a $107 million tax refund; failure to secure this refund would materially increase the effective tax rate and income tax liability.

1. CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. announced first-quarter fiscal year 2026 (ended April 30, 2025) results, including $1.10 billion in total revenue (a 20% year-over-year increase) and $4.44 billion in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR), representing a 22% year-over-year growth.
2.  The company's Board of Directors approved a share repurchase program of up to $1.0 billion of its common stock, effective June 3, 2025.

3. CrowdStrike projects non-GAAP income from operations of $226.9 - $233.1 million for the second quarter of fiscal year 2026 (ending July 31, 2025) and $970.8 - $1,010.8 million for the full fiscal year 2026 (ending January 31, 2026).

1. On June 2nd, 2025, PulteGroup, Inc. eliminated its Series A Junior Participating Preferred Shares, as no shares were outstanding and no options or warrants existed that could require their issuance.
2. The filing states that as of June 2nd, 2025, no Series A Preferred Shares were outstanding.
3. This action removes the Certificate of Designation of Series A Preferred Shares from the company's Restated Articles of Incorporation, effective upon filing on June 2nd, 2025.

1. Altria Group, Inc. is temporarily suspending trading under its employee benefit plans (DPS Plans) from 4:00 p.m. Eastern Time on July 10, 2025, to sometime during the week of July 13, 2025, due to a trustee services transition from State Street Bank to Fidelity Management Trust Company.

2.  As per a June 3, 2025, notice to directors and executive officers,  trading restrictions under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and Regulation BTR will prohibit direct or indirect purchase, sale, or transfer of company common stock during the blackout period and for two years afterward.
3. The company notified its directors and executive officers of the trading restrictions in accordance with Section 306(a) of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and Section 104 of Regulation BTR.
1. On June 2nd, 2025, Claude Mongeau resigned as Chair of Norfolk Southern Corporation's Board of Directors for personal reasons.
2.  The SEC filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure.
3. A new Board Chair will be appointed at a scheduled meeting later in June 2025.

1. Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. shareholders approved amendments to the 2009 Stock Incentive Plan on May 29, 2025, increasing the number of shares available for issuance by 10,000,000 and extending the plan's term to May 31, 2035.
2.  Shareholder votes on Proposal 5 (amending the Certificate of Incorporation to limit officer liability) showed significantly more opposition (18,926,602 against) than other proposals.

3.  The May 29, 2025, amendment to Zimmer Biomet's Certificate of Incorporation limits the personal liability of certain officers for monetary damages for breach of the duty of care, as permitted under Delaware law.
1. F. Philip Snow retired as CEO and director of FactSet Research Systems Inc. on September 1, 2025,  being replaced by Sanoke Viswanathan.
2. Sanoke Viswanathan's compensation includes a $1,000,000 annual base salary, a target bonus of 200% of his base salary, and equity awards totaling $33,000,000  in his first three years.

3. Mr. Viswanathan will receive a $13,000,000 cash payment from JPMorgan Chase & Co. in connection with his departure, $10,000,000 of which is subject to repayment if he leaves FactSet within one year.
1. Dollar General's 2025 fiscal year will be a 52-week period ending January 30, 2026, while the 2024 fiscal year was a 52-week period ending January 31, 2025.
2.  As of May 2, 2025, obligations outstanding under the supply chain finance program totaled $338.8 million, down from $399.7 million on January 31, 2025.

3. The FASB issued new disaggregated expense disclosures effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2026, and an update to income tax disclosures effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2024; Dollar General is assessing the impact of both.
1. Dollar General Corporation's Q1 2025 net sales increased by 5.3% year-over-year to $10.4 billion, driven by new stores and same-store sales growth, partially offset by store closures.

2.  Despite exceeding internal expectations in Q1 2025, Dollar General updated its fiscal year 2025 guidance to reflect tariff uncertainty, now projecting net sales growth of approximately 3.7% to 4.7% and same-store sales growth of approximately 1.5% to 2.5%.

3.  The company's board declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.59 per share payable on or before July 22, 2025, to shareholders of record on July 8, 2025; however, future dividends are subject to the board's discretion and depend on various factors.

1. Philip Morris International Inc. reaffirmed its 2025 full-year forecast on June 3, 2025, predicting reported diluted EPS of $7.01 to $7.14 and adjusted diluted EPS of $7.36 to $7.49, representing a projected growth of 12% to 14% and 10.5% to 12.5% excluding currency.
2.  Compared to 2024, the company projects a significant year-over-year increase in adjusted diluted EPS of 10.5% to 12.5% (excluding currency).

3. The company identified several risks to its projections, including excise tax increases, marketing and regulatory restrictions, health concerns, litigation, competition, economic and political developments, changes in smoker behavior, counterfeiting, currency fluctuations, and the impact of the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
1. IQVIA Holdings Inc. announced on June 2, 2025, that its subsidiary intends to issue $2,000,000,000 in senior notes due 2032.
2. The notes offering, expected to close around June 4, 2025, will bear interest at a rate of 6.250% per annum.
3.  The proceeds will primarily repay existing borrowings and cover offering expenses; any excess will be used for general corporate purposes.
1. On May 30, 2025, Cigna Group appointed Michael J. Hennigan as an independent member of its Board of Directors, effective June 2, 2025.
2. Mr. Hennigan will participate in Cigna Group's non-employee director compensation program, as described in the company's Proxy Statement filed on March 14, 2025.
3. Cigna Group will file an amended Form 8-K to disclose Mr. Hennigan's committee assignments at a later date.
Failed to analyze filing
1. At the 2025 Annual Meeting (held on May 29th, 2025), Mosaic Company stockholders elected twelve directors for a one-year term expiring in 2026.
2.  The Say-on-Pay Advisory Proposal received 222,059,413 votes in favor and 17,797,388 votes against, indicating significant support but also considerable opposition.
3. KPMG LLP was ratified as Mosaic's independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2025, with 256,891,897 votes in favor and 9,795,242 votes against.
1. Constellation Brands divested a portion of its lower-margin wine and spirits business on June 2, 2025.
2.  The company redeemed $900 million in Senior Notes before their maturity dates.
3.  Constellation Brands' financial outlook for fiscal years 2026, 2027, and 2028 remains unchanged following the divestiture.
